abstract.text: BIP141: Signature(s) must be null vector(s) if an OP_CHECKSIG or OP_CHECKMULTISIG is failed (for both pre-segregated witness script and P2WSH. See BIP146). Relay/mining policy rule 3.
BIP141: Total transaction size is the transaction size in bytes serialized as described in BIP144, including base data and witness data.
BIP141 - Segregated witness data associated with this input.
Signature version or effectively the version of
which affects how some operations are decoded and executed.
Mandatory script verification flags that all new transactions must comply with for them to be valid. Failing one of these tests may trigger a DoS ban. See
on Bitcoin Core  for details.
Note that this does not affect consensus validity. See
for that.
Lock time value applied to this transaction. It represents the earliest time at which this transaction should be considered valid.
Used exclusively  in
Self is an x-only public key.
Passing a non-strict-DER signature or one with undefined hashtype to a checksig operation causes script failure.
Evaluating a pubkey that is not (0x04 + 64 bytes) or (0x02 or 0x03 + 32 bytes) by checksig causes script failure.
Not used or intended as a consensus rule.
A reference to a specific
of a particular
which is stored in a
A script operation.
This is the script code for signing Pay-to-Witness-Public-Key-Hash inputs. It contains the same operations as a Pay-to-Public-Key-Hash output script but the signature version is bumped to Witness V0.
A Bitcoin transaction.
The numeric sequence value.
Constructs a transaction input.

BIP62 rule 4: Zero-padded number pushes Any time a script opcode consumes a stack value that is interpreted as a number, it must be encoded in its shortest possible form. ‘Negative zero’ is not allowed.
Calculates the merkle root as well as some additional tree info for generating control blocks.
BIP65: Evaluate
A fully decoded Bitcoin script and its associated signature version.
BIP141: Verify witness program (all witness versions).
Creates a sequence with a specific value. Use only in verion 1 transactions.
List of all decoded script operations.
The amount in
encumbered by this output.
The script that unlocks the output associated with this input.
BIP62 rule 3-4
Require minimal encodings for all push operations (
where possible, direct  pushes up to 75 bytes,
up to 255 bytes,
for anything larger).
Evaluating any other push causes the script to fail (BIP62 rule 3).
In addition, whenever a stack element is interpreted as a number, it must be of minimal length (BIP62 rule 4).
Creates a script from a list of operations.
The transaction’s identifier. More
. Serialized as big-endian.
Making unknown
non-standard.

Script verification flags represented by config options. All flags are intended to be soft forks: the set of acceptable scripts under flags (A | B) is a subset of the acceptable scripts under flag (A).
Creates a script from raw data.
Evaluates the script with a new stack. All previous mutable state is reset.
BIP342: The TapRoot Script (Tapscript) Common Message Extension as defined in BIP342
The script that locks this output.
Transaction version 1.
BIP62 rule 6
Require that only a single stack element remains after evaluation. Only to be used with P2SH.
Discourage use of NOPs reserved for upgrades (NOP1-10)
The transaction’s version.
All of the inputs consumed (coins spent) by this transaction.
Initialize from serialized raw data.
BIP 144
Extensions for BIP341 taproot.
The sequence number for this input.
BIP141
The transaction’s witness identifier as defined in BIP141. More
. Serialized as big-endian.
BIP62 rule 5
Passing a non-strict-DER signature or one with S > order/2 to a checksig operation causes script failure.
Creates a transaction from its inputs and outputs.
Bitcoin SCRIPT execution context.
BIP141: Transaction weight is defined as Base transaction size * 3 + Total transaction size (ie. the same method as calculating Block weight from Base size and Total size).
Extensions for BIP341 taproot.
BIP62 rule 2
Using a non-push operator in the scriptSig causes script failure.

A hash function which takes a transaction along with some context and produces a hash value for use with signature operations. The function only accepts a signature hash type which allows for commitments to different parts of the tx.
BIP68 - Transaction version 2.
Making unknown public key versions (in BIP342 scripts) non-standard.
BIP112: Evaluate
Making OP_CODESEPARATOR and FindAndDelete fail any non-segwit scripts
Creates a reference to an output of a previous transaction.
Lock time value for a

. If less than 500,000,000 is interpreted as the minimum block height at which the transaction is unlocked. When equal or greater than 500,000,000 it represents the time (UNIX epoch) at which the transaction is unlocked. Use 0 to disable the time lock entirely.
The index of an output in the referenced transaction.
Simple script execution
BIP68 - Untested. Entrypoint 2.
Creates a sequence from a relative lock time specified in blocks (version 2 transactions only).
The sequence value of a
BIP16
Creates an output out of an amount (value) and a locking script.
Making v2-v16 witness program non-standard.
BIP141: The argument of OP_IF/NOTIF in P2WSH must be minimal. Relay/mining policy rule 2.
BIP141: Only compressed public keys are accepted in P2WPKH and P2WSH (See BIP143). Relay/mining policy rule 1.
A signature with sighash type extension.
The numeric lock time value.
BIP66 (consensus) and BIP62 rule 1 (policy)
Passing a non-strict-DER signature to a checksig operation causes script failure.
Creates a sequence from a relative locktime specified as a seconds interval (coin age). Use only with version 2 transactions.
The list of elements that makes up this witness.
Standard Schnorr signature extended with the sighash type byte.

Basic elements of the Bitcoin protocol, namely transactions and scripts.

Standard script verification flags that standard transactions will comply with. However we do not ban/disconnect nodes that forward txs violating the additional (non-mandatory) rules here, to improve forwards and backwards compatability.
The output of a

Serialization of the script’s operations into raw data. May include unparsable data.
A reference to a previously unspent output of a prior transaction.
A value expressed in satoshis which is typically associated with a transaction
Making unknown Taproot leaf versions non-standard.

The portion of the original script data that could not be decoded into operations.
Raw format byte serialization of this transaction. Supports updated serialization format specified in BIP144.

Attempts to parse the script and return its assembly representation. Otherwise returns an empty string.

Verify dummy stack item consumed by
is of zero-length.

BIP141: Virtual transaction size is defined as Transaction weight / 4 (rounded up to the next integer).
BIP341, BIP342: Taproot/Tapscript validation.
